questions.question_text:
A Procurement Contracts user wants to create a deliverable with output document as Purchase Order in Oracle Purchasing Cloud. The user would like to know the status of the PO creation and also details of the PO.
Identify the location where the user can view this information.

choices.C: The user can view the purchase order in the "Purchasing Activity" tab under the Fulfillment tab of that contract in Procurement Contracts.
choices.D: The User can view the PO information under the Purchasing tab in contract line of that contract in Procurement Contracts.
choices.A: The user can view the purchase order in the Deliverable tab of that contract in Procurement Contracts.
choices.B: The user cannot view the PO information in Procurement contract. They must navigate to Purchasing.

questions.question_text: Identify five business functions that must be configured in order to implement a complete Procure-to-Pay business process in Oracle Procurement Cloud.

discussion.content: sorry, i was wrong!! The answer is correct

choices.B: Apply price updates to existing orders

questions.question_text: Identify two control options that are enabled when a buyer selects the ‘Group requisition lines’ field while creating a Blanket Purchase Agreement.

choices.A: The supplier has a default payment method of Check.
choices.B: The payment method Electronic is end-dated on the Payment Method tabbed page of the supplier profile for the supplier.
choices.C: The supplier does not have an active Purchase Order.
choices.D: The supplier must have a Blanket Purchase Agreement in place.
choices.E: The From Date field value for the payment method Electronic is a future date.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
B, E are correct

questions.question_text:
The Payables department has reported that a supplier is not appearing in the Submit Payment Process Request. The payment method selected from the payment processing options at Submit Payment Process Request is Electronic.
Identify two reasons why the supplier is not appearing in the Submit Payment Process Request.

You gave the Procurement Catalog Administrator role to a buyer of the business unit "BU1" but when the buyer is trying to define a catalog in "Select and define catalog", the buyer is unable to find "BU1" in the "Procurement BU" list of values.
Identify the reason for this.

choices.A: The "Local Catalog administrator BU1" data role is not assigned to the buyer.
choices.C: The "Manage Catalog content" action is not enabled for the buyer in the Procurement Agent page.
choices.B: The "Procurement Catalog Administrator BU1" data role is not assigned to the buyer.
choices.D: The "Catalog Management" business function is not enabled for BU1.

discussion.content:
There is one answer : C
"The “Manage Catalog content” action is not enabled for the buyer in the Procurement Agent page".

Not sure on answer. 
Rasheed's seems wrong and 2 answers were not asked for by the question.
